#summary Overview of (E)CCPxCON registers per PIC

----

= Overview of (E)CCPxCON registers per PIC =

Standard and Enhanced CCP control registers are on separate lines.

The absence of ECCPxCON register(s) does not mean that the
PIC has no enhanced CCP module(s)!
Some PICs use a 'standard' CCPxCON register,
even when the CCP module is 'enhanced'.
A mix is possible too: one standard CCPxCON register may control
a standard CCP module while another standard CCPxCON register
controls an enhanced CCP module.
<br>According to the datasheets of PICs with enhanced CCP modules
controlled by a CCPxCON register this register contains a PxM field.
When this field is present the CCPxCON register in the table
below is prefixed with '(e)'.
<br>Unfortunately not all .dev files of PICs with enhanced CCP module(s)
using standard CCPxCON register(s) have a PxM field declared!
So <b>CCPxCON registers without (e) prefix may still be for
an enhanced CCP module!</b>
<br><i>This wiki may be extended later after more analysis.</i>
